item.title: Four of a family suffer burn injuries in Noakhali
item.description: Four members of a family, including two children, sustained burn injuries in a fire at their flat in Basurhat Municipality of Companiganj upazila, Noakhali, on Wednesday night. One of the victims was later shifted to Dhaka, reports UNB. Kumod Chandranath, father of the children and a pharmaceutic

item.title: CA condoles death of his friend world renowned zoologist Dr Jane
item.description: Chief Adviser Professor Muhammad Yunus has expressed deep sorrow at the death of his friend Dr Jane Goodall, a world-renowned zoologist, primatologist, anthropologist, and conservationist. “I am deeply saddened by the passing of my dear friend Dr Jane Goodall, a world renowned zoologist, pri

item.title: Typhoon Bualoi leaves 34 dead in Vietnam
item.description: Typhoon Bualoi and subsequent floods and landslides have left 34 people dead, 20 missing, and 140 others injured, with estimated economic losses of 8.78 trillion Vietnamese dong (about 356 million US dollars), Vietnam News Agency reported Wednesday. The typhoon caused severe damage to infrastructu

item.title: Apple halts Vision Pro overhaul to focus on AI glasses
item.description: Apple has halted a planned overhaul of its Vision Pro mixed-reality headset to shift resources to smart glasses that would rival products from Meta Platforms, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter. The iPhone maker had been preparing a cheaper, lighter varian

item.title: Pakistan says 13 militants killed in operations in Balochistan
item.description: Thirteen terrorists were killed during two intelligence-based operations in Pakistan's southwest Balochistan province, the Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR) said on Wednesday. The operations were conducted on Sept. 30 and Oct. 1 in Quetta and Kech districts, the ISPR, the media wing of the Pa

item.title: 26 killed in Nigeria boat accident
item.description: At least 26 bodies have been recovered during a rescue operation after a fully loaded boat capsized in Nigeria's central state of Kogi, local authorities said Wednesday. The boat, conveying mostly traders travelling from the Ibaji local government area of Kogi to the Ilushi market in the southern

item.title: 30 killed in Ethiopia scaffolding collapse
item.description: At least 30 people were killed on Wednesday when a wooden scaffolding collapsed in Ethiopia's Amhara Region, state media reported. The makeshift structure, set up for the construction of a church in the town of Arerti, collapsed in the early hours of the morning, killing more than 30 worshipers an

item.title: Journalists boycott NCP briefing at airport over alleged harassment
item.description: National Citizen Party (NCP) activists have been accused of harassing journalists at Shahjalal International Airport in Dhaka. In protest against the incident, reporters subsequently boycotted the party’s press conference. The incident took place around 9:45 am on Thursday outside the airpor
